definition: to look completely new (idiom); brand new/changed beyond recognition
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
abbr. for Xinjiang 新疆[Xin1 jiang1] or Singapore 新加坡[Xin1 jia1 po1]/surname Xin

sentences.english: The rebuilt path to the office is made of used sleepers and ballast.
sentences.chinese: 通往事务所的枕木步道整理得焕然一新。

sentences.english: I am sure with these tips your kiss will be refreshed.
sentences.chinese: 我肯定这会让你的吻焕然一新。

sentences.english: It's heat therapy, which is getting a new look with the help of microscopic particles of gold.
sentences.chinese: 这种古老的治疗方式在黄金微粒的帮助下焕然一新。

sentences.english: The now-clean cat will rocket out of the toilet, and run outside where he will dry himself.
sentences.chinese: 焕然一新的猫将冲出马桶，跑到屋外把自己弄干。

sentences.english: The financial services industry worldwide will never be the same.
sentences.chinese: 全球金融服务业将会焕然一新。

sentences.english: And may your dreams leave you renewed, make you wake to sunlight.
sentences.chinese: 愿好梦常萦，令你焕然一新，迎接灿烂晨曦。

sentences.english: After renovation and reconstruction the old port has changed beyond recognition.
sentences.chinese: 这个老港经过改造和建设，面貌焕然一新。

sentences.english: Since the policy of China's reform and opening up was carried out, rural area has made a refreshing change.
sentences.chinese: 自从中国实行改革开放政策以来，农村面貌焕然一新。

sentences.english: Nowadays ZAZ (that is a short name for the plant) is absolutely different than before.
sentences.chinese: 现在的扎波罗热汽车厂绝对是面貌焕然一新。

sentences.english: The removal of these sad sheds created the opportunity for the cheerful new building.
sentences.chinese: 这些工棚被拆除后，焕然一新的大楼便可拔地而起了。

sentences.english: One hundred thousand college students become village official , will may make rural area face having a bright , new look.
sentences.chinese: 十万大学生当村官，将会使农村面貌焕然一新。

sentences.english: Map design will never be the same.
sentences.chinese: 以后的地图设计都将是焕然一新。

sentences.english: CAR BODY: Protect your car's finish with a good waxing.
sentences.chinese: 清洗车身后在漆面上打蜡将使汽车的外观焕然一新。

sentences.english: I'd like to freshened up a little.
With a spell of "China Red", the Diplomatic Center took on an entirely new look at night.
sentences.chinese: 当晚的总理府大厅内外焕然一新，呈现一片中国红。

sentences.english: In a matter of minutes you can completely exfoliate your skin.
sentences.chinese: 短短几分钟就可以使你的肌肤焕然一新。

definition: complete change (idiom); facelift/We're in a wholly new situation.
to shed one's mortal body and exchange one's bones (idiom); born again Daoist/to turn over a new leaf/fig. to change wholly/to create from other material (story, artwork etc)
a pleasant change/a breath of fresh air/refreshing
from the inside to the outside/through and through/thoroughly
sky and the earth turning upside down (idiom); fig. complete confusion/everything turned on its head
